result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Newsom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be due no later than 7/1/2017. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for four days (4/1/2015 to 4/4/2015).

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.  Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid presription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, fiream magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.

fine set at zero.
Driver license suspension is not imposed.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully compelte recommended treatment.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extendd supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned  to prison.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John W Newsom in court with attorney Calvin R Malone. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 4 days (4-1-2015 to 4-4-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due no later than 07-01-2017; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant John W Newsom in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to branch 44.

Defendant's Sentencing Submissions received and filed. tk

Defendant John W Newsom in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 11/24/15 at 8:30 am, Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report dated October 19, 2015 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.
